meanings.definition: An experienced and trusted advisor or guide.
meanings.sent1: My mentor at work always helps me with my questions.
meanings.sent2: She sought guidance from her mentor before making a big decision.
meanings.sent3: The wise mentor chuckled at the young apprentice's silly mistake.
meanings.sent4: Like a lighthouse in a storm, the mentor's wisdom guided the team through challenges.
meanings.sent5: The mentor's words were like a beacon of light in the darkness of confusion.

meanings.definition: To advise or train someone, especially a younger colleague.
meanings.sent1: I will mentor you on how to improve your skills in this field.
meanings.sent2: She decided to mentor the new intern to help them succeed in their role.
meanings.sent3: The experienced employee decided to mentor the new hire with patience and care.
meanings.sent4: His dedication to mentoring others inspired the whole team to grow together.
meanings.sent5: She took it upon herself to mentor the next generation of leaders with passion and dedication.
